title: Automorphic form
summary: In harmonic analysis and number theory, an automorphic form is a well-behaved function from a topological group G to the complex numbers (or complex vector space) which is invariant under the action of a discrete subgroup Γ ⊂ G {\displaystyle \Gamma \subset G} of the topological group. Automorphic forms are a generalization of the idea of periodic functions in Euclidean space to general topological groups.
